Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery closed vessel, probably an olpe; exterior: from top, trace of black on neck with narrow dilute brown band below; black-figure lion to right, looking back (head and neck with added red on muzzle, eye, tongue and possibly mane and added white on teeth, remaining).
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B103.20.1)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 254, no. 5)
Beazley 1944 / Groups of Early Attic Black Figure (p. 42, no. 15)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 299, no. B291)
Venit 1984 / Early Attic Black Figure Vases in Egypt (p. 144, note 24, 2)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 223, no. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0287) (Phase 1)
